DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this prospective, non-randomized, single-arm, research study is to evaluate the accuracy of acutely extracting respiratory rate and tidal volume from implanted cardiac device impedance in subjects with heart failure. In addition, to assess the feasibility of extracting respiratory rate from device EGM under various conditions.
DOC.brief_title: RESpiration deTection From Implanted Cardiac Devices in Subjects With Heart Failure (REST-HF)
DOC.criteria: Subject must have heart failure and be undergoing implant of a new or replacement/upgrade Medtronic dualchamber ICD or CRTD device for approved indications; Subject must be implanted with an RV lead that supports bipolar pacing and sensing (i.e. a true bipolar defibrillation lead); Subject must receive a light conscious sedation or no sedation where breathing maneuvers can be performed and evaluated during the implant; Subject must be willing to provide Informed Consent for their participation in the study; Subject must be â‰¥ 18 years of age. Subjects who are unable or unwilling to voluntarily participate in any visit required by the study and to provide consent; Subject has congenital heart disease; Subject has a tachyarrhythmia (atrial and/or ventricular) at the time of enrollment and a cardioversion will not be attempted prior to the research procedure; Subject has unstable coronary artery disease; Subject requires cardiac pacing at rest for rate support; Subject presents any concomitant conditions which in the opinion of the investigator would not allow a proper execution of the respiratory exercises as per protocol; Subject presents any concomitant condition which in the opinion of the investigator would not allow a safe participation in the study; Subject is pregnant or breast feeding; Subject is legally incompetent; Subject is enrolled in a concurrent study that may confound the results of this study without documented preapproval from Medtronic study manager.
